intro: Centropogon gamosepalus, commonly known as the scarlet gorse, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its bright red bracts that surround its small white or yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is often found in sandy or rocky soils. It has a shrub-like appearance with woody stems and small, leathery leaves. Centropogon gamosepalus is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its striking floral display.
